content.text: SNIPER: run - The Universal Code Runner

text: An intelligent code runner that automatically detects a source file's language,
compiles it in memory (if necessary), and executes it. It supports a wide
range of compiled and interpreted languages for a seamless development workflow.

content.text: The 'run' tool relies on having the necessary compilers and interpreters installed and in your system's [bold]PATH[/]. For example, to run a [cyan].go[/] file, the [cyan]go[/] command must be available.

text: [green]-t, --time[/]             Measure and report execution time, memory usage, and CPU stats.
[green]-w, --watch[/]            Watch the file for changes and automatically re-run on modification.
[green]-j, --parallel[/]         Run multiple files concurrently. All files after this flag are run in parallel.
[green]-i, --interactive[/]      Enter an interactive shell (REPL) to execute shell commands on the fly.
[green]--limit-time <sec>[/]     Terminate the program if it runs longer than N seconds.
[green]--limit-mem <KB>[/]       Terminate the program if it uses more memory than N kilobytes.
[green]-v, --verbose[/]          Enable verbose output, showing compilation and execution commands.
[green]--no-color[/]            Disable colored output in the 'run' tool's own messages.
[green]-h, --help[/]             Display this help message and exit.
[#] Compile and run a C++ file, measuring its performance:
[yellow]run[/] [green]-t[/] [cyan]main.cpp[/]
[#] Run a Python script and pass arguments to it:
[yellow]run[/] [cyan]my_script.py[/] [dim]--user=admin --port=8080[/]
[#] Watch a Go program for changes and re-run automatically:
[yellow]run[/] [green]-w[/] [cyan]server.go[/]
[#] Run three different scripts in parallel:
[yellow]run[/] [green]-j[/] [cyan]script1.py task.c job.sh[/]
[#] Run a script, but terminate it if it takes longer than 5 seconds:
[yellow]run[/] [green]--limit-time 5[/] [cyan]long_running_task.py[/]
‚Ä¢ [bold]"Compiler 'gcc' not found":[/] The required compiler for the file type is not installed or not in your PATH.
‚Ä¢ [bold]"Compilation Failed!":[/] The source code contains a syntax error. Run with [cyan]-v[/] to see the compiler's output.

‚Ä¢ [bold]"Permission denied":[/] The script file does not have execute permissions. 'run' handles this for compiled code, but for scripts like [cyan].sh[/], you might need to [cyan]chmod +x[/] it first.
